signature.instructions:
Given the fields `question`, produce the fields `answer`.

You will be given `question` and your goal is to finish with `answer`.

To do this, you will interleave Thought, Tool Name, and Tool Args, and receive a resulting Observation.

Thought can reason about the current situation, and Tool Name can be the following types:

(1) AdvancedSearch, whose description is <desc>Searches documents using a search_query.  Arguments:  - "search_query": an optimized search query for dense passage retrieval.  IMPORTANT: YOU MUST always PROVIDE "search_query" in the arguments!</desc>. It takes arguments {'search_query': 'str', 'trajectory_id': 'Union[str, NoneType]'} in JSON format.
(2) finish, whose description is <desc>Signals that the final outputs, i.e. `answer`, are now available and marks the task as complete.</desc>. It takes arguments {} in JSON format.

demos.question: Do director of film Miss Lovely and director of film Good Will Hunting have the same nationality?
demos.trajectory:
[[ ## tool_name_init ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "Do director of film Miss Lovely and director of film Good Will Hunting have the same nationality?"}

[[ ## thought_init ## ]]
I will start by searching for relevant documents with the original question as the search query.

[[ ## observation_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "Do director of film Miss Lovely and director of film Good Will Hunting have the same nationality?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\nGibson, Michael Mann, and Steven Soderbergh. Originally, Affleck asked Kevin Smith if he was interested in directing. He declined, saying they needed a \"good director\" and that he only directs things he writes and is not much of a visual director, but still served as one of the film's executive producers. Damon and Affleck later chose Gus Van Sant for the job, whose work on previous films like \"Drugstore Cowboy\" (1989) had left a favorable impression on the fledgling screenwriters. Miramax was persuaded", "score": 0.7919921875}, {"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\nand would go on to score many of the director's other films. The film also features many songs written and recorded by singer-songwriter Elliott Smith. His song \"Miss Misery\" was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Original Song, but lost to \"My Heart Will Go On\" from \"Titanic\". Elfman's score was also nominated for an Oscar, but lost to \"Titanic\" as well. On September 11, 2006, \"The Today Show\" used Elfman's song \"Weepy Donuts\"", "score": 0.794921875}, {"long_text": "Miss Misery\n\"Miss Misery\" is a song by American singer-songwriter Elliott Smith. Featured in the closing credits and the soundtrack of the 1997 film \"Good Will Hunting\", the song was nominated for Best Original Song in the 1997 Academy Awards.\nA previous version of \"Miss Misery\" with different lyrics was recorded in Jackpot! Recording Studio in early 1997 and appears on the 2007 posthumous collection \"New Moon\". The \"Good Will Hunting\" version was re-cut at Jackpot!\nMusic", "score": 0.806640625}, {"long_text": "Mr. Wonderful (film)\nMr. Wonderful is a 1993 romantic comedy film directed by Academy Award-winning director Anthony Minghella.\nThe film stars Matt Dillon, Annabella Sciorra, Mary-Louise Parker, William Hurt and features one of the few appearances of Vincent D'Onofrio as a romantic character.\nSynopsis.\nGus DeMarco (Matt Dillon), an electrician, wants to purchase a bowling alley with his friends. The problem is that he still pays alimony to his ex-wife, Leonora (Annabella Sciorra).", "score": 0.81494140625}, {"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\nGood Will Hunting is a 1997 American drama film, directed by Gus Van Sant, and starring Robin Williams, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Minnie Driver, and Stellan Skarsgård. Written by Affleck and Damon, the film follows 20-year-old South Boston janitor Will Hunting, an unrecognized genius who, as part of a deferred prosecution agreement after assaulting a police officer, becomes a client of a therapist and studies advanced mathematics with a renowned professor. Through his therapy sessions, Will re-evaluates his relationships", "score": 0.84130859375}]}

[[ ## thought_0 ## ]]
Now that I have the relevant passages, I will analyze them to find information about the nationality of the directors of the films "Miss Lovely" and "Good Will Hunting".

[[ ## tool_name_0 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the nationality of the director of film Miss Lovely and the director of film Good Will Hunting?", "trajectory_id": "0"}

[[ ## observation_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the nationality of the director of film Miss Lovely and the director of film Good Will Hunting?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Miss Lovely\nfilm constantly switches between genre pieces and is part hard-boiled film noir, part love story, part melodrama and part documentary. It has been compared to Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s \"The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant\", and Wong Kar Wai's \"Chungking Express\". \nShot on a combination of Kodak Super 16 and 35mm film in widescreen, central themes of Miss Lovely include repressed sexuality, censorship, the deconstruction of genre, the material nature of celluloid and the extinction of cinema itself. The film", "score": 0.787109375}, {"long_text": "All I Wish\nAll I Wish (also titled A Little Something for Your Birthday) is a 2017 American romantic comedy film written and directed by Susan Walter and starring Sharon Stone (who was also a producer), Tony Goldwyn, Famke Janssen and Ellen Burstyn. It is Walter's directorial debut.\nPlot.\nSenna Berges (Sharon Stone), a clothing designer, is desperate to find her soulmate. Despite the constant attempts to pursue her passion for fashion design, Senna follows a path of irresponsible behavior,", "score": 0.787109375}, {"long_text": "Beautiful Ohio (film)\nBeautiful Ohio is a 2006 American film, directed by Chad Lowe and starring William Hurt, Michelle Trachtenberg, and Julianna Margulies. The film, based on the short story \"Batorsag and Szerelem\" by Ethan Canin, is a coming of age drama/comedy set in the 1970s.\nCast.\n- William Hurt as Simon Messerman\n- Julianna Margulies as Mrs. Cubano\n- Michelle Trachtenberg as Sandra\n- Brett Davern as William\n- David Call as Clive\n- Rita Wilson as", "score": 0.787109375}, {"long_text": "William Wyler\nWilliam Wyler (; born Willi Wyler (); July 1, 1902 – July 27, 1981) was an American film director, producer and screenwriter. Notable works include \"Ben-Hur\" (1959), \"The Best Years of Our Lives\" (1946), and \"Mrs. Miniver\" (1942), all of which won Academy Awards for Best Director, as well as Best Picture in their respective years, making him the only director of three Best Picture winners as of 2019. Wyler", "score": 0.7880859375}, {"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\nscholars have examined the film as a portrayal of residual Catholic–Protestant tensions in Boston, as Irish Catholics from Southie are aligned against ostensibly Protestant characters who are affiliated with Harvard and MIT.\nReception Accolades.\n- 70th Academy Awards\n- 55th Golden Globe Awards:\n- 4th Screen Actors Guild Awards:\n- Other Major Awards / Nominations:\nSoundtrack.\nThe musical score for \"Good Will Hunting\" was composed by Danny Elfman, who had previously collaborated with Gus Van Sant on \"To Die For\"", "score": 0.7890625}]}

[[ ## thought_1 ## ]]
I will now analyze the information about the directors' nationalities to determine if they are the same.

[[ ## tool_name_1 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Are the nationalities of the directors of films Miss Lovely and Good Will Hunting the same?", "trajectory_id": "1"}

[[ ## observation_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Are the nationalities of the directors of films Miss Lovely and Good Will Hunting the same?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "List of Rhode Island School of Design people\n- Gus Van Sant (B.F.A. 1975) – film director, \"My Own Private Idaho\" (1991), \"Good Will Hunting\" (1997), \"Finding Forrester\" (2000), \"Elephant\" (2003) \"Last Days\" (2006), \"Milk\" (2008)\n- Todd Verow (B.F.A. 1989) – film director\nNotable alumni Artists Furniture design.\n- Amy Devers (M.F.A. Furniture Design 2001) – furniture designer; television personality\n- Brodie Neill (M.F.A. Furniture Design", "score": 0.77880859375}, {"long_text": "Minnie Driver\nAmelia Fiona \"Minnie\" Driver (born 31 January 1970) is an English-American actress and singer-songwriter.\nDriver has been nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress and a Screen Actors Guild Award in Gus Van Sant's \"Good Will Hunting\" (1997) for her role as Skylar, she was also nominated for both an Emmy Award (2007) and a Golden Globe Award (2008) for her work in the television series \"The Riches\", and for an Emmy", "score": 0.77880859375}, {"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\na playwriting class he was taking at Harvard University. Instead of writing a one-act play, Damon submitted a 40-page script. He wrote his then-girlfriend, medical student Skylar Satenstein (credited in the closing credits of the film), into his script. Damon said the only scene from that script that survived — \"it survived verbatim\" — was when Will Hunting (Damon) meets his therapist, Dr. Maguire (Robin Williams). He then came to Ben Affleck and asked him to develop the screenplay together", "score": 0.7802734375}, {"long_text": "Lovely (surname)\nLovely is an English surname. Notable people with the surname include:\n- Arvinder Singh Lovely (born 1968), Indian politician\n- Joan Lovely, American politician\n- John A. Lovely (1843–1908), American jurist\n- Louise Lovely (1895–1980), Australian actress\n- Pete Lovely (1926–2011), American racecar driver\n- Stephen Lovely (born 1966), American writer", "score": 0.78271484375}, {"long_text": "Good Will Hunting\nthriller aspect of the story and to focus on the relationship between Will and his therapist. Terrence Malick told Affleck and Damon over dinner that the film ought to end with Will's decision to follow his girlfriend Skylar to California, not them leaving together.\nAt Reiner's request, screenwriter William Goldman read the script. Goldman consistently denied the persistent rumor that he wrote \"Good Will Hunting\" or acted as a script doctor. In his book \"Which Lie Did I Tell?\" Goldman jokingly writes, \"I did", "score": 0.78369140625}]}

[[ ## thought_2 ## ]]
I will now look for information about the nationality of the director of the film "Miss Lovely" to determine if it matches the nationality of the director of the film "Good Will Hunting".

[[ ## tool_name_2 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the nationality of the director of the film Miss Lovely?", "trajectory_id": "2"}

[[ ## observation_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the nationality of the director of the film Miss Lovely?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Ashim Ahluwalia\nAshim Ahluwalia (born 1972 in Mumbai, India) is a film director and screenwriter. He made his directorial debut with the feature-length documentary \"John & Jane\" (2005), which had a world premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival and a European premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival, and won him the 2005 National Film Award for Best First Non-Feature Film of a Director. This was followed by his first narrative feature film \"Miss Lovely\", premiered at the 2012 Cannes", "score": 0.81298828125}, {"long_text": "Lovely (2012 film)\nLovely is a 2012 Telugu-language romantic comedy film written and directed by B. Jaya. The film was produced by B. A. Raju and Anoop Rubens has composed the music for the film. The film stars Aadi and Shanvi Srivastava in the lead roles. The film was a joint production between R. R. Movie Makers and RJ Cinemas. Alongside direction, both editing and screenplay were also handled by B. Jaya. The Movie was released on 30 March 2012 and was a hit at the box office.", "score": 0.82666015625}, {"long_text": "Miss Lovely\nMiss Lovely is a 2012 Indian drama film directed by Ashim Ahluwalia and set in the criminal depths of Mumbai's C-grade (horror and porn film) industry. Ahluwalia's debut feature follows the story of the Duggal brothers who produce sleazy sex-horror films in the mid-1980s. The plot explores the intense and mutually destructive relationship between younger sibling Sonu Duggal, played by Nawazuddin Siddiqui, and his elder brother, Vicky (Anil George). Sonu finds himself drawn to a mysterious young woman named Pinky (", "score": 0.828125}, {"long_text": "Miss Lovely\n, color and off-screen space. One feels a real affection for this admittedly sordid universe, but with a magnificence that the conversion of India to the market economy will simply wipe out.\"\nAnother Magazine's Simon Jablonski reviewed the film, saying \"Among all that glitters at Cannes Film Festival, there was little quite as visually spectacular as Miss Lovely, directed by Ashim Ahluwalia. In the midst of India’s moralistic and conservative codes of censorship, Miss Lovely dived into the world of the secret sex and horror", "score": 0.83251953125}, {"long_text": "Miss Lovely\ncharacters' social milieu.\"\nSight & Sound's Jonathan Romney described the director Ashim Ahluwalia as \"a very impressive talent, and given the oppressive conventions of the Indian film industry, he’s clearly an independent spirit and then some.\"\nFilm Comment's Gavin Smith felt that the film was the strongest in the Un Certain Regard section writing \"I hope we do hear more from Indian director Ashim Ahluwalia, whose lively, fast-and-loose Miss Lovely, about two brothers toiling in the world of Bollywood", "score": 0.84326171875}]}

[[ ## thought_3 ## ]]
Now that I have found information about the nationalities of the directors of the films "Miss Lovely" and "Good Will Hunting", I will analyze this information to determine if they are the same.

[[ ## tool_name_3 ## ]]
finish

[[ ## tool_args_3 ## ]]
{}

[[ ## observation_3 ## ]]
Completed.
demos.reasoning: The director of the film "Miss Lovely" is Ashim Ahluwalia, an Indian film director. The director of the film "Good Will Hunting" is Gus Van Sant, an American film director. Therefore, the nationalities of the directors of the films "Miss Lovely" and "Good Will Hunting" are different.
